question: At which among the following temperatures, the indicator of Celsius and Fahrenheit thermometers will show the same reading?
explanation:
The formulas for converting between degree Celsius and degree Fahrenheit are: °F = (°C * 9/5) + 32 => °C = (°F - 32) * 5/9 To find the temperature when both are equal, we use an old algebra trick and just set ºF = ºC and solve one of the equations.
     °C = (°C * 9/5) + 32 =>°C - (°C * 9/5) = 32 =>-4/5 * °C = 32 =>°C = -32 * 5/4 =>°C = -40 OR
      °F = (°F * 9/5) + 32 =>°F - (°F * 9/5) = 32 =>-4/5 * °F = 32 =>°F = -32 * 5/4 =>°F = -40
